ygData.subject: Re: Raw deal - need help!
ygData.msgSnippet: Umm... I never said that there were never going to be bugs... I m not trying to start a war about this, but after four months they still can t fix the boat
ygData.messageBody:
Umm...
I never said that there were never going to be bugs... I'm not trying to
start a war about this, but after four months they still can't fix the boat
issue???? Give me a break... I program mods for Q2 and HL and I would be
ashamed if we couldn't get rid of a bug that hampered so many players..

I enjoy playing EQ and sure bugs are always going to be there which isn't a
major problem...but the CUSTOMER SERVICE part is....

I guess i'm just a little bit anal when it comes to customer service
because I own a web design company...

Jeremy

-----Original Message-----
From: Dave Gaines [SMTP:dave@...]
Sent: Thursday, July 08, 1999 9:01 AM
To: EQ_SMITHS@onelist.com
Subject: Re: [EQ_SMITHS] Raw deal - need help!

From: Dave Gaines <dave@...>

Time for me to disagree here. Think of the alternatives:

1. The game is still buggy, lets delay shipment until the game is
no longer buggy. (That means YOU don't get to play)
The might still be working on this game getting the bugs out. You
would still be playing Quake2.

2. The game is still buggy, exec's at Verant decide to can this project
since the bugs will never be worked out and it just isn't feasible.
YOU never get to play.

3. The release this game in March, you get to enjoy the game, albiet with
a few bugs. Play around the bugs, live with the bugs because the rest
of the gaming experience is so fun.

If you honestly feel that you shouldn't play this game until the bugs are
worked out. Cancel your account, and I will email you when the last bug
is gone, at which time you can open a new account.

David

> From: Jeremy Spielmann <spielman@...>
>
> Curtis..
> I have to say I disagree with the way you feel. We all bought and paid
for
> a game that we love playing. We all pay money each month to play this
game
> online. As a programmer myself I feel as if the bugs should have been
> worked out by now. I have gone through this same routine with the guys
at
> Verant and can say it is the worst customer service that I have ever
> received. I sat online for 4 hours waiting for a GM to help me out and
> still no one came. Sure there are a few hundred people saying they lost
> things when they really didn't lose anything at all..
>
> I'm still waiting for an email regarding a video problem that I'm having.
I
> switched video cards and can't get the game to work properly. I've been
> waiting for that email for 2 1/2 weeks now....
>
> When game companies release a game they should make sure that the bugs
are
> pretty much gone after beta testing. Sure there are going to be
problems,
> but then these companies should have the support needed to help
customers
> out..
>
> IMO
>
> Thx
> Jeremy (Shanuk)
>
> -----Original Message-----
> From: Curtis Beck [SMTP:jungle@...]
> Sent: Thursday, July 08, 1999 8:09 AM
> To: EQ_SMITHS@onelist.com
> Subject: Re: [EQ_SMITHS] Raw deal - need help!
>
> From: Curtis Beck <jungle@...>
>
> Kale,
> I know how you feel, but I don't have a solution for you. I have lost
> a character before on the Karan server when it was crashing all of the
> time.
> Lost a level 12 char with full banded. Luckly for me I had some friends
> that
> were able to get me some patchwork armor and a mino axe and worked my
> way back
> to where I was.
>
> Tanaman
>
>
> kale usi wrote:
> >
> > From: kale usi <kaleusi@...>
> >
> > I feel as though I'm getting the raw end of the deal from Verant. I
lost
> 10
> > P and an Opalline earring (paid 25 P for it) off an alt character, due
to
> > yet another bug/glitch with the boat. I've done everything I can
possibly
> > think of, (/tell, /shout, /petition, /bug, /feedback, and email
directly
> to
> > a GM at the suggestion of a Guide) to get this equipment restored. And
> I've
> > done them all numerous times and still nothing!
> >
> > One Guide told me that a request to have my equipment restored had been
> > forwarded, and that it would take 2 days at most to get it restored
(now
> > going onto day 4); quite truthfully, I'm more upset at losing the
> opalline
> > earring than any of the other gear (it being the hardest and most
> expensive
> > to replace); and still nothing has been said or done about it - no
email,
> no
> > /tell's, no nothing in any way shape or form to explain what the holdup
> is.
> >
> > In fact, all I keep getting from most of the Guides about anything, is
> that
> > "I'm too busy right now. Please /petition it." If I petition one more
> time
> > and get no response, I'm going to scream! As a matter of fact, I still
> have
> > a petition in queue right now in the queue of my primary character and
> the
> > alt that lost the equipment, and guess what, it's still not answered!
> >
> > What I'd like, is for any Verant employee/cohort to sit up and take
> notice,
> > or for anyone who has an idea about how to get this situation taken
care
> of
> > to submit their suggestions via post or email, so that I can get this
> > straightened out once and for all!!! I'm sick to death of hearing "I'm
> too
> > busy" or "It's not our policy" or "Sorry. It's against policy to do
> that".
> > I've done everything I can short of calling Verant's support hotline,
> like
> > I'm supposed to! Are you GM's and Guides there just to create lag? Or
for
> > once will you do what it is that you're s there to do? Customer
support!
> > ****(I'm not holding my breath!!!!!!!!!!!)****
